title: (x) "Introducing" book serif face - Dolly {Mathieu Christe}
content:
Can anyone tell me what font is used here. It has been used in this very bold version and light or roman. Also is this classed as an Egyptian font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808071111im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Intro_Font.jpg)

 [‹ (x) "The Medicine Shoppe" swashy serif - Bookman Swash {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808071111/http:/typophile.com/node/19272 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Hostess logo - hand lettered (similar to Eckmann) {Nick Cotrell (Tiff)} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808071111/http:/typophile.com/node/19266 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tonymcguigan

comments.content:
Looks like Trump Mediaeval but in a bolder weight than I can find.

Edit: nah, not quite it.

That must be “Dolly” (bodl weight) from Underware.  
—-\> [http://www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=dolly&id2=bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808071111/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=dolly&id2=bold "http://www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=dolly&id2=bold")  
A friend of mine purchased it and recently told me it was real pleasure using it!
